@drudd are you able to update this in the next few days? Releasing 0.20.3 by the end of the week. Are there any questions on the implementation or desired behavior?
Hi Tom, sorry, I was traveling over the weekend. I should be able to clean this up hopefully address comments today.
@drudd if you can fix up. we want to include with 0.20.3, releasing tomorrow.

Okay, I reported the issue of factorization (#16844), which unfortunately is difficult to work around. I've added some checks in the `.from_arrays` function to prevent `.from_arrays(arrays=[])` from being valid and adjusted tests accordingly. Not as clean as I'd like but any further changes are api breaking.

@jreback ~~I'm not sure I followed your last comment on the `MultiIndex.from_tuples([], names=['a', 'b'])` test. You agree with the test but think it should raise? My fix to the `.isin` issue relies on `.from_tuples` succeeding when passed an empty list, which unlike `.from_arrays` I believe to be correct behavior as it's the right input shape.~~  Nevermind, I see it followed from the discussion. I think I've addressed the major points and reduced the PR to the minimal change set.
